natural solution: Using the associative property and simplifying gives \begin{align} (15x^2) \cdot (6x) \cdot \left(\frac{1}{(3x)^2}\right) &= (15 \cdot 6) \cdot (x^2 \cdot x) \cdot \left(\frac{1}{9x^2}\right)\\ &= \frac{90x^3}{9x^2}\\

a_7.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 15 * x powr 2"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = 6 * x"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. R x = 1 / (3 * x) powr 2"
shows  "P x * Q x * R x = 10 * x"
a_7.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 What is $(15x^2) \cdot (6x) \cdot \left(\frac{1}{(3x)^2}\right)$? The final Answer is 10x
 ### Proof

 &= 10x^{3-2} = \boxed{10x}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 15 * x powr 2"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = 6 * x"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. R x = 1 / (3 * x) powr 2"
shows  "P x * Q x * R x = 10 * x"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_7.informal problem: Given the functions $P(x) = 15x^2$, $Q(x) = 6x$, and $R(x) = \frac{1}{(3x)^2}$, find an expression for the product $P(x) \cdot Q(x) \cdot R(x)$. The final answer is $10x$.

a_8.formal problem:

assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 15 * x powr 2"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = 6 * x"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. R x = 1 / (3 * x) powr 2"
and h3 : "\<forall> x. S x = P x * Q x * R x"
shows  "S x = 10 * x"
a_8.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 What is $(15x^2) \cdot (6x) \cdot \left(\frac{1}{(3x)^2}\right)$? The final Answer is 10x

 &= 10x^{3-2} = \boxed{10x}. \end{align}
 *)

fixes x :: real and P Q R S :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 15 * x powr 2"

and h2 : "\<forall> x. R x = 1 / (3 * x) powr 2"

shows  "S x = 10 * x"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
